get.description: Find a list of publishers with details like descriptions, logos, languages, categories, and links to their social media.

parameters.name: query
parameters.description: Just type what you're looking for.

parameters.name: country
parameters.description: 2-letter ISO 3166-1 code of the country.

parameters.name: language
parameters.description: 2-letter ISO 3166-1 code of the language.

parameters.name: category
parameters.description: Possible options: general, business, entertainment, lifestyle, politics, science, sports, technology.

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: Possible options: popularity, relevancy.

get.description: This API endpoint provides access to the comprehensive metadata and content of a specific article.

parameters.name: url
parameters.description: The URL of the article.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: The article content output type can be specified as eitherhtml or plaintext. The default output type is plaintext. Note: The content is accessible only to users who have a valid subscription plan.

get.description: Find articles by keywords and allows you to filter by country, language, publisher, and date to get specific result.

parameters.name: query
parameters.description: Just type what you're looking for, like cats or weather. If you want to exclude term, just add minus (-) in front of any term (nasa -moon).

parameters.name: language
parameters.description: example: en, fr, de, zh-Hant. Check out the Supported Languages endpoint to see a list of all the languages you can search for.

parameters.name: publisher
parameters.description: A domain of the news source. Example: cnn.com

parameters.name: from
parameters.description: Accepts human-readable formats like 1d for 1 day, 1m for 1 month, 1y for 1 year, as well as ISO 8601, RFC 2822, and Unix timestamp formats.

parameters.name: to
parameters.description: Accepts human-readable formats like 1d for 1 day, 1m for 1 month, 1y for 1 year, as well as ISO 8601, RFC 2822, and Unix timestamp formats.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: This parameter controls the maximum number of articles returned on a single page.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: This parameter specifies the page number you want to access. For example, page=2 will return the second page of results.

get.description: This endpoint gives you the ability to find new and engaging content by randomly selecting an article, with the option to filter by country or language.

parameters.name: language
parameters.description: example: en, fr, de, zh-Hant. Check out the Supported Languages endpoint to see a list of all the languages you can search for.

parameters.name: topic
parameters.description: The topic of interest, example: General, Politics, Sports, or a subtopic Soccer. Check out the Supported Topics endpoint to see a list of all the topics you can search for.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: The article content output type can be specified as eitherhtml or plaintext. The default output type is plaintext. Note: The content is accessible only to users who have a valid subscription plan.

get.description: This endpoint lets you find the most popular news article for a specific country, language, and topic (like sports or entertainment).

parameters.name: date
parameters.description: Example value:

parameters.name: topic
parameters.description: The topic of interest, example: General, Politics, Sports, or a subtopic Soccer. Check out the Supported Topics endpoint to see a list of all the topics you can search for.

parameters.name: language
parameters.description: example: en, fr, de, zh-Hant. Check out the Supported Languages endpoint to see a list of all the languages you can search for.

parameters.name: country
parameters.description: example: us, in, fr, de, id . Check out the Supported Countries endpoint to see a list of all the countries you can search for.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: This parameter controls the maximum number of articles returned on a single page.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: This parameter specifies the page number you want to access. For example, page=2 will return the second page of results.

get.description: This endpoint provides a list of supported countries along with their respective languages.
This endpoint provides a list of supported languages.
This endpoint provides information about the supported topics. Access to the specific topics may be restricted based on your subscription plan.
